title: baiters/advance_fee/sources/scamorama/fadgina_petter.html
notes: Harry Fadgina, last seen in WINKY WANKY WOO, returns with a story that offers a treasure trove for the serious student of scambaiting. Major style points for enforcing the use of code names, and obtaining Oaths! Also note lovely fake certificates and pop culture references.

messages.body:
Dear Scamorama
 
Please find below the latest exploits of Harry Fadgina, this time in the guise of a Secret Agent (008) working for British Intelligence.. I strung him along for five weeks, by which time he was getting quite frustrated, although he never did draw my attention to the fact that I called him by the wrong name the whole time!
 
I will attach the pictures  ... especially my spoof Oaths, which are once again a tip of the hat to my mentor, Lady Agatha.
 
The highlight for me was when he forgot which name he was using and replied as "Foo Cheng Donald". He covered this up by saying it was his tax attorney, but nevertheless I made him sign the Loyal Oath of Integrity too, and, funnily enough, it was in the same handwriting.
Cast of Characters:
. Our Lad. He says he is in Malaysia, and wants the money to be wired to Kuala Lumpur. He is most definitely of African origin though, judging by his accent.
. Our hero. Harry works as secret agent 008 for British Intelligence (MI6). When not busy baiting unscrupulous 419 scammers, he is living the exciting life of a James Bond movie.
. See Barrister . Our Lad slips up and signs one email in error with this name. When challenged, he claims it is his Tax Attorney.
. Voo Petter's "P.A.", the nominated recipient of the Western Union transfer, so possibly a real person?

Barrister Foo Cheng Donald. See Barrister Voo Petter. Our Lad slips up and signs one email in error with this name. When challenged, he claims it is his Tax Attorney.

Chigoze Miracle. Voo Petter's "P.A.", the nominated recipient of the Western Union transfer, so possibly a real person?

[Rated CN1 for crude but naughty rather than nasty.]

JALAN KUNING,TAMAN PELANGI.
JOHOR BAHRU.   
MALAYSIA.

TEL: +60 166196038

Dear  Harry Fadgina,       
 
Bearing in mind the nuture of the content of this letter coming from a person without referral, i apologize for any inconvenience, but please read and objectively consider if we can work together
 
I am  Voo Petter, an attorney at law.A deceased client of mine,by name 
Mr Mike Fadgina, who here in after shall be referred to as my client, died as the result of a heart-related condition on the 21 November 2004. His heart condition was due to the death of all the members of his family in the Gulf Air Flight Crashes in Persian Gulf Near Bahrain Aired August 23, 2000 - 2:50 p.m. ET as reported on: http://transcripts.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/0008/23/bn.08.html
I have contacted you to assist in distributing the money left behind by my client before it is confiscated or declared unserviceable by the bank where this deposit valued at 12.5million dollars is lodged. This bank has issued me a notice to contact the next of kin, or the account will be confiscated. 
My proposition to you is to seek your consent to present you as the next-of-kin and beneficiary of my Late Client, since you have the same last name, so that the proceeds of this account can be paid to you. Then we can share the amount on a mutually agreed-upon percentage. all legal documents to back up your claim as my client's next-of-kin will be provided. all i require is your honest cooperation to enable us see this transaction through. 
This will be executed under a legitimate arrangement that will protect you from many breach of the law. If this business proposition offends your moral values do accept my apology. I must use this opportunity to implore you to exercise the utmost indulgence to keep this matter extraordinary confidential, whatever your decision, while I await your prompt response.Please contact me at once to indicate your interest. I will like you to acknowledge the receipt of this e-mail as soon as possible via my private email (voopetterlawchamber@gmail.com)  this transaction will be treated private with absolute confidentiality and sincerity. I look forward to your quick reply.

Yours truly,
Barrister Voo Petter.

messages.body:
30 June 2008

Dear Barrister Voo Peter
 
Thank you very much for your message. What a shock this has been to me! You see, you say that I may be able to claim the money in this account because I have the same surname as the deceased, but I think in this case I REALLY AM related to Mike Fadgina, who I think could be my dear late uncle Mickey! How amazing is that?! And how clever of you to find me.
 
As a matter of interest can you please explain how you did trace me? I use a private email address and this is usually exclusively reserved for work contacts. I am a security operative with the British Government division MI6, so as you can imagine I must insist on absolute secrecy in this deal and cannot risk having this email address compromised in any way.
 
Please confirm receipt of this email by return and include the code words PURPLE HELMET in the address header. I cannot respond unless you are prepared to use this discretion.
 
Now, back to business: I believe that your Mike Fadgina may well be my late Uncle, who tragically died from cardiac amoebic dysentery on 21 Nov 2004. It was a dreadful business as the undertaker had to ladle him into the coffin. Uncle Mickey was distraught at the deaths of his entire family in a plane crash four years previously when Gulf Air Flight 472 crashed into the Gulf of Marmite.
 
Can you please confirm the following details:
 
1) The details of the flight given above are the same as those in your records
2) That the name of your former client was MIKE HUNT FADGINA, born on 01 April 1945 in Felchingham
3) That the picture I have attached of my dear late Uncle Mickey is, in fact, the same gentleman who was your former client.

[]


 
 
If you are able to confirm these details I shall be delighted to go ahead and assist any way I can with this deal, and you shall be handsomely rewarded my friend.
 
Kind regards
Harry Fadgina 008 (PINK OBOE)

messages.body:
PURPLE HELMET

30 June 2008

Attention: Harry Fadgina,
 
First, let me introduce my self once more, I am Barr.Voo Petter.Esq,a legal practitioner with Voo Petter Law Chamber in Johor Bahru,Malaysia. I got your email through a research of Database and I was doing that because I have just few days left to present my decease client's relative to the bank or they will confiscate his account.
 
1) The details of the flight given above are the same as those in your records, YES
2) That the name of your former client was MIKE HUNT FADGINA,YES
3)  born on 01 April 1945 in Felchingham VERY CORRECT
 
I am a married father of four,  I am a senior advocate in Johor Bahru Malaysia. As I told you in my proposal mail, I chose you because of your last name, which is exactly the same as my late client's name, who died in Kuala Lumpur hospital of heart related disease. However, I will really appreciate your understanding to cooperate and work with me for the successful conclusion of this project.
 
The fund will be transferred to your account by the holding institution here after a successful claim has been made.There is no risk to this transaction as we will process all the required documents by law for a beneficiary claim.There are no other living relative,actually my client was born by two immigrant workers that came to Malaysia in 50's.

In this transaction we will go step by step. First, the legal documents to back up the claim and secondly,the monetary documents for the transfer.As I also made you to understand in my first mail, the Bank asked me to contact his beneficiary/ his next of kin.As his Lawyer, he did not leave any beneficiary name or next of kin with me.Facing the situation, I decided to search for a good person of trust and one who bears the same last name as my late client that will suite as his/her next of kin/Bone fie beneficiary.
 
You must understand that in the finance industry,chances or opportunities like this are common but not heard. People put their monies in banks and some of these accounts are either coded or confidentially operated,therefore, when such people die what do you think that happens to these monies when nobody comes for their claims? Well, this is one of the numerous avenues good "free" monies are made within and amongst the officials. I did not mastermind my client's death and I did not operate or manage his account but i was his personal attorney so was privy to his transaction with the bank.
 
For the legal ramifications, be rest assured on that.This is my operational field, for I do know all the loop holes involved and will handle them with great professionalism.I will provide all the necessary legal documents that will back you up as the Bone fie 
beneficiary of my late client. I need  you  to cooperate with me and be honest in our agreement, which is 60/40,60 for me and 40 for you. If this is OK by you, I will send you a beneficiary affidavit form from the high court, which you will fill and resend to me, for me to swear under oath in high court of Malaysia that you are truly the Bone fie beneficiary of my late client  and from here we will commence.
 
Fill free to ask any question you want to ask for better understanding of the transaction.If I can count on your honesty, cooperation and confidence, reply positively for me to start the paper work.
Note:  Here is my private numbers,+60166196038,you can reach me at any time of the day,except when i have a case to defend in court.I will also like to have a phone number to reach you. 
 
Yours faithfully, 
Barr.Voo Petter.

04 July 2008

Dear Peter
 
Yes, I am very interested in assisting you with this transaction if you will confirm that the man in the attached photograph is really my late Uncle Mickey Fadgina. It is a little old as it was taken when he was still working on the buses, but I'm sure you will recognise him. As he is my ACTUAL next of kin it should make the process of getting our hands on the money much simpler.

He was a lovely man, always laughing. I used to bring him tea and biscuits and he'd call me his "Little Butler". I'd often hear him shouting "I'll get you, Butler!" or "That's made my day, that has!" Happy days!
 
He also spoke fondly of his time in Malaysia, and I think he did once mention visiting his barrister at his office.
 
Please confirm the details above and I think we will be in business.
 
I must stress however that the utmost secrecy must be maintained - I don't want M or Q finding out about this.
 
Kind regards
Harry Fadgina 008
MI6 Headquarters
London SW1

messages.body:
I NEED YOUR ASSURANCE!


04 July 2008

Dear Harry Fadgina,
 
Yes, I have noted the attached photo and he is my decease client, So we need to proceed and get this fund transfer before the bank confiscate it. Late Mr.Fadgina was my client.
 
The law stipulates that where a deceased person do not give instructions on who will inherit his/her estate, the next of kin status will be determined by information stored in the security file jacket of the deceased with the bank.
 
I appreciate your interest to claim the funds and will work closely with you for the successful conclusion of the claim.Trust, sincerity and Confidentiality is very important in this transaction considering the amount of money involved. Money matters require absolute trust,sincerity and confidentiality for the security of both parties involved.
 
I am concerned about the safety of the funds when it is transferred to your account. 
The total sum of USD12.5M will be transferred to your account.You will be entitled to 40% of the total funds,  while i will earn 60% for my services. I require that you assure me that you will release both my share  when the funds is transferred to your account and i come to your country for the sharing/disbursement of the funds.
I need to get your assurance before i send the Affidavit Form which I will obtain in the High Court in your Name and send to you for you to fill and send back to me to anable me file your name at the Court as the rightful beneficiay to the fund. 
 
You can reach me with this number +60166196038  any time of the day.
 
Please, include your personal cell phone number to enhance our communication.
 
I await your call or email.
 
Sincerely,
Barr.Voo Petter.

Dear Peter
 
Thank you for your response. I understand the need you have to be reassured about the honest distribution of these funds. However, I am disappointed that you doubt me. 
 
As you can see from my previous email, I am employed on operations with MI6, the British Secret Intelligence Service. I would not be working for such an organisation if I did not possess integrity. Furthermore, I am an English gentleman, and you should accept my word on this.
However, as I am keen to get this moving, I have asked my secretary Miss Falange to draft up an agreement, which I have signed in good faith. 
Harry's Oath:


In return I expect you to sign the attached blank copy and return it to me.
 
Blank Oath for Voo to sign:



Then, and only then, shall we be able to do business.
 
Regards

Harry Fadgina 008
 
PS. In order to preserve secrecy, please do not forget to include our code word PURPLE HELMET in the header so that I know it is you.

10 July 2008 

Dear Peter 
 
Thanks for your message and the attached Oath and Affadavit.
 
Before we proceed, just a couple of small points: Firstly, in your last email you addressed me as "Fadgina", which is my surname. Calling someone by just their surname is very disrespectful in my country. Please address me as "Harry", "Harold", "Harry Fadgina", "Mr Fadgina", "Sir" or even "008".
 
Secondly there are a couple of issues of concern over the affadavit. In paragraph 2, you state that I am of the "Felchingam" region when, in actual fact, I live in FelchingHam. Please correct this typographical error because, as I'm sure as a barrister you will be aware, it will invalidate the affadavit. 
 
Also, in paragraph 4, it says that I am a secret agent with M16 - this should be "MI6", i.e. a letter "I" and not the number "1". Paragraph 4 also states "and presently disc overture", which makes no bloody sense at all. Is that some kind of special legal jargon?
 
Not a very impressive performance so far, Peter. Please get it right from now on, as you will be aware of how important attention to small details can be, especially after you have already paid so much in stamp duty and oath fees.
 
Sort it out man, and then we can talk.
 
Sincerely
Harry Fadgina 008
